page.title: 01Introduction to Four Lanes.
page.content: { {LANDSCAPE &BUILDINGS.} The area of Four Lanes is a plateau which is dominated by the hill feature of{Carmenellis}which is 252m above sea-level.This is on the southern edge of our area and gives a fine view for miles. The landscape has a moorland look but is mainly grassland of good and {Croftlike}quality. The area is one of many smallholdings quite widely scattered with small fields enclosed by Cornish stone hedges.The farmhouses are small,mainly built of Cob.In Four Lanes the older houses are miners cottages mostly in terraces built in granite.There are three post 1945 war estates, two are mainly bungalows the other is mainly council houses built in the 1970's.The area is well served by minor roads and is crisscrossed by numerous lanes and tracks.
